meanings.definition: The act of putting two things together in a relationship
meanings.sent1: The pairing of peanut butter and jelly is a classic example of combining two things.
meanings.sent2: I love the pairing of black shoes with a white dress.
meanings.sent3: The pairing of socks and sandals is a fashion statement only a few can pull off.
meanings.sent4: In cooking, the perfect pairing of flavors can elevate a dish to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The pairing of music and dance creates a harmonious experience for the audience.

meanings.definition: A set of two similar or matching things
meanings.sent1: The store was selling a special pairing of gloves and a scarf for the winter season.
meanings.sent2: His earrings were a beautiful pairing of pearls and silver.
meanings.sent3: The pairing of identical twins always fascinated their friends.
meanings.sent4: The pairing of the two paintings in the gallery showcased the artist's versatility.
meanings.sent5: The pairing of red roses and white lilies made a stunning bouquet.

meanings.definition: A couple or partners, especially in a romantic or working relationship
meanings.sent1: The romantic pairing of the lead actors in the movie was well-received by the audience.
meanings.sent2: The business pairing of the two entrepreneurs led to a successful startup.
meanings.sent3: The pairing of the detective duo always solved the case in record time.
meanings.sent4: The pairing of the two best friends in the competition brought out their competitive spirit.
meanings.sent5: The pairing of the chef and sommelier ensured a delightful dining experience for the guests.
